medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noted shaking of his hands, the right more than the left, 8 months ago following an upper respiratory infection. Symptoms improved spontaneously, and one month later, he could play the piano. After another 3 to 4 months, he experienced cramping of the right hand and decreased endurance, leading to fatigue without obvious weakness. Over 1 month, he noticed loss of dexterity in the right hand without pain or numbness. Six weeks before evaluation, he developed bilateral weakness of the elbow flexors and difficulty handling tools. One week prior to evaluation, he could not walk more than half a mile due to fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Rheumatoid arthritis in remission for 6 years after treatment with weekly methotrexate for 1 year. Previous knee surgery for left patella dislocation.
medical_history.family_history: The father died at age 47 from alcoholic cirrhosis. The patient has two siblings who are well. No other family members had similar symptoms.
medical_history.social_history: Married with one child, works in an office, and plays the piano. No other lifestyle factors mentioned.
